result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Anthony Moncivaiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Anthony Moncivaiz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Anthony Moncivaiz was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Michael Anthony Moncivaiz was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pertains to both counts: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Pertains to both counts: Defendant may petition Court, after two years, for expunction of record, upon successful completion of probation and no new charges.

Pertains to both counts: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess or consume alcohol. Complete anger management counseling.  Periodic review to be done in nine months. 

Pertains to both counts: State has no objection to probation being terminated after 18 months if agent deems appropriate. Judge White prefers two years probation stay in effect.

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on December 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael Anthony Moncivaiz in court with attorney Robert B. Hurley.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading waived on Amended. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to counts  3&4. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yr. probation. Conditions: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess or consume alcohol. Complete anger management counseling. $243 costs on each count. Periodic review to be done in nine months. Defendant may petition the court for expungement, after two years, upon successful completion of probation and no new charges. State has no objection to probation being terminated after 18 months if agent deems appropriate. Court prefers two years probation stay in effect.
 Court granted 2 days jail credit. Ct. 1 dismissed. Ct. 2 read in and dismissed. Case called 1:15 p.m., adjourned 1:45 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Hearing scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
